section.title: API versions
section.para: Lists information for all API versions.

section.title: Availability zones (os-availability-zone)
section.para: Gets availability zone information.

section.title: Server actions (servers)
section.para: Performs actions on a server. Specify the action in the request body.

section.title: Server admin actions (servers)

section.title: Server IPs (ips)
section.para: Lists the IP addresses assigned to an instance or show details for a specified IP address.

section.title: Server backups (servers)
section.para: Backs up a server instance.

section.title: Admin password (os-admin-password)
section.para: Clears the encrypted copy of the password from the metadata server after the client gets the password and determines that it no longer needs it in the metadata server. The password for the server remains the same.

section.title: Guest agents (os-agents)
section.para: Creates, lists, updates, and deletes guest agent builds. Use guest agents to access files on the disk, configure networking, or run other applications or scripts in the guest while the agent runs. This hypervisor-specific extension is not currently enabled for KVM. Use of guest agents is possible only if the underlying service provider uses the Xen driver.

section.title: Host aggregates (os-aggregates)
section.para: Creates and manages host aggregates. An aggregate assigns metadata to groups of compute nodes. Aggregates are only visible to the cloud provider.

section.title: Cells (os-cells)
section.para: Adds neighbor cells, lists neighbor cells, and gets the capabilities of the local cell.

section.title: Root certificates (os-certificates)
section.para: Creates and shows details for a root certificate.

section.title: Configuration drive (os-config-drive)
section.para: Returns server details for a specific service ID or user.

section.title: Server console output (os-console-output)
section.para: Gets console output for a server instance.

section.title: Server deferred delete (os-deferred-delete)
section.para: Force-deletes a server or restores a deleted server.

section.title: Evacuate (os-evacuate)
section.para: Evacuates servers.

section.title: Servers with extended availability zones (os-extended-availability-zone)
section.para: Shows the instance availability zone for compute nodes (nova-compute). Internal services appear in their own internal availability zone.

section.title: Server extended attributes (os-extended-server-attributes)
section.para: Shows metadata for servers.

section.title: Server extended status (os-extended-status)
section.para: Shows extended status information, vm_state, task_state, and power_state, in detailed server responses.

section.title: Flavor access (flavor-access)
section.para: Flavor access support.

section.title: Flavor extra-specs (flavor-extra-specs)
section.para: Lists, creates, deletes, and updates the extra-specs or keys for a flavor.

section.title: Flavors manage (flavor-manage)
section.para: Creates and deletes flavors.

section.title: Flavors with rxtx_factor extended attribute (os-flavor-rxtx)
section.para: Shows the rxtx status of a flavor.

section.title: Flavors with extended attributes (flavors)

section.title: Floating IP DNS records (os-floating-ip-dns)
section.para: Manages DNS records associated with IP addresses allocated by the floating IPs extension. Requests are dispatched to a DNS driver selected at startup.

section.title: Floating IP pools (os-floating-ip-pools)
section.para: Manages groups of floating IPs.

section.title: Floating IPs (os-floating-ips)
section.para: Assigns and allocates floating IP addresses to instances that run in an OpenStack cloud.

section.title: Floating IPs bulk (os-floating-ips-bulk)
section.para: Bulk-creates, deletes, and lists floating IPs. By default, the pool is named nova.
Use the os-floating-ip-pools extension to view available pools.

section.title: Hosts (os-hosts)
section.para: Manages physical hosts.

section.title: Hypervisors (os-hypervisors)
section.para: Displays extra statistical information from the machine that hosts the hypervisor through the API for the hypervisor (XenAPI or KVM/libvirt).

section.title: Server actions (servers)
section.para: Permits all users to list available actions for a specified server. Permits administrators to get details for a specified action for a specified server.

section.title: Instance usage audit log (os-instance-usage-audit-log)
section.para: Administrator only. Monitors task logs.

section.title: Keypairs (keypairs)
section.para: Generates, imports, and deletes SSH keys.

section.title: Limits (limits)
section.para: Shows all global and rate limit information.

section.title: Migrations (os-migrations)
section.para: Shows data on migrations.

section.title: Multinic (os-multinic)

section.title: Servers multiple create (servers)
section.para: Creates one or more servers with an optional reservation ID. The request and response examples show how to create multiple servers with or without a reservation ID.

section.title: Quota class (os-quota-class-sets)
section.para: Provides quota classes management support.

section.title: Quota sets (os-quota-sets)
section.para: Permits administrators, depending on policy settings, to view quotas for a tenant and view and update default quotas.

section.title: Server remote console (os-remote-consoles)
section.para: Provides interactive console support.

section.title: Server diagnostics (os-server-diagnostics)
section.para: Gets the usage data for a server.

section.title: Server usage (os-server-usage)
section.para: Adds launched_at and terminated_at values to servers.

section.title: Server shelve (servers)
section.para: Shelves running servers, restores shelved servers, and removes shelved servers.

Shelving is useful when you have an unused instance that you would like to keep for later use. For example, at the end of a work week you can shelve an instance and at the start of the next week you can unshelve it.
Your cloud provider might bill you for a shelved server.
Use the shelve action to shelve a server. All associated data and resources are kept but anything still in memory is not retained.
Use the unshelve action to restore a shelved instance.
Use the shelveOffload action to remove a shelved instance that you no longer need.

section.title: Server password (os-server-password)
section.para: Gets the encrypted administrative password set through the metadata service.

section.title: Usage reports (os-simple-tenant-usage)
section.para: Shows simple tenant usage for a tenant.

section.title: Virtual interfaces (os-virtual-interfaces)
